text:
“Thank you. But shall I not disturb the invalid?” Pyotr Petrovitch asked.

“N-no,” mumbled Zossimov. “You may amuse him.” He yawned.

“He has been conscious since morning,” Razumihin said cheerfully.

“Your mamma…” Luzhin started.

“Hmm!” Razumihin interrupted, clearing his throat.

Luzhin looked puzzled. “That’s all right, go on.”

“Your mamma began a letter to you while I was nearby. I waited to see you, to ensure you had the news.”

“I know, I know!” Raskolnikov cried, vexed. “So you are the fiancé? I know, and that’s enough!”

Silence filled the room. Pyotr Petrovitch frowned, confused.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses impatience upon realizing that Pyotr Petrovitch is his mother's fiancé.
